{"step_by_step_thinking": "Diabetes mellitus is a condition that affects the body's ability to use blood sugar for energy. It is known to cause various complications, including heart disease. Coronary artery disease, a type of heart disease, involves the narrowing or blockage of the coronary arteries. Complex coronary lesions are a severe form of this disease. Given the link between diabetes and heart disease, it is reasonable to infer that complex coronary lesions may be more frequent in patients with diabetes mellitus.", "answer_choice": "A. yes"}
